sen.j: そうしている間に、幕府軍が千早城に大軍を貼り付けにしながら落とせずにいるとの報に触発され、各地に倒幕の機運が広がっていった。
sen.e: In the meantime, provinces received the news that the bakufu army had clung to the Chihaya-jo Castle but yet to take the Castle.

Meanwhile, on receiving the news that, despite having been engaged in fighting to take Chihaya-jo Castle for such a long time, the bakufu army had yet to take control of it, the feeling that the time was ripe to overthrow the bakufu spread throughout the provinces of Japan.

sen.j: 播磨国では赤松則村（円心）が挙兵し、その他の各地でも反乱が起きた。
sen.e: In the Harima Province, Norimura AKAMATSU (Enshin) raised an army, and revolts occurred in the other areas.

sen.j: 中でも赤松則村は周辺の後醍醐方を糾合し京都へ進撃する勢いであった。
sen.e: Among others, Norimura AKAMATSU had a great power to storm Kyoto by rallying the Godaigo armies around.

sen.j: このような状況を見て、閏2月、後醍醐天皇は名和長年の働きで隠岐島を脱出した。
sen.e: Having seen the circumstances, in leap February, Godaigo escaped from the Oki no shima Island with the aid of Nagatoshi NAWA.

sen.e: Then, Godaigo entered Mount Senjo in the Hoki Province and issued rinji (the Emperor's command) of overthrowing the bakufu to the nation.

sen.j: 幕府は船上山を討つため足利尊氏、名越高家らの援兵を送り込んだ。
sen.e: The bakufu dispatched reinforcements led by Takauji ASHIKAGA and Takaie NAGOE to defeat Mount Senjo.

sen.e: Families and followers of Rokuhara Tandai including Nakatoki HOJO and Tokimasu HOJO attempted to escape to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region).
